title: James Maguire (rugby union)
text:
James Richard Maguire (6 February 1886 – 1 December 1966) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. Mainly a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Back%20row">backrow forward</a>, Maguire represented at a provincial level between 1905 and 1910. He was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, on their <a href="1910%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Australia">1910 tour of Australia</a>. He played six matches for the All Blacks on that tour—five of them at <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Hooker">hooker</a>—including three internationals.
Maguire was also a noted rower, being a part of the Waitemata four that won a national title in 1909.
Maguire died in <a href="Lower%20Hutt">Lower Hutt</a> on 1 December 1966, and was buried at <a href="Karori%20Cemetery">Karori Cemetery</a>.
